TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi sealed beforefieldinit CustomPopupPlacement extends System.ValueType

Docs.summary: Defines custom placement parameters for a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The CustomPopupPlacement structure defines a location for a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Popup> control with respect to its parent, and defines how the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Popup> moves to become more visible when it is obscured by a screen boundary.
A <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.CustomPopupPlacementCallback?displayProperty=fullName> delegate returns an array of these structures as custom placement options for a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Popup> when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Popup.Placement%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.PlacementMode>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Windows.Point point, valuetype System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.PopupPrimaryAxis primaryAxis) cil managed

Docs.param: The that is relative to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Popup.PlacementTarget%2A> where the upper-left corner of the is placed.
The along which a control moves when it is obstructed by a screen edge.

Gets or sets the point that is relative to the target object where the upper-left corner of the control is placedl.
Docs.value: A that is used to position a control. The default value is (0,0).

remarks.format: ## Remarks The target object is the element that the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Popup> is relative to. For more information, see [Popup Placement Behavior](../Topic/Popup%20Placement%20Behavior.md).

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the direction in which to move a control when the is obscured by screen boundaries.
Docs.value: The direction in which to move a control when the is obscured by screen boundaries.
